newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine weekly official crop progress.
newsitem.headline: Argentine weekly official crop progress.

text.p: Argentine farmers had sown 18.4 percent of their total intended maize area of 3.8 million hectares by October 4, the Agriculture Secretariat said Thursday in its weekly crop report.

Some 64.5 percent of wheat area was fertilized this year, compared with 50.6 percent last season. While most of the maize area has enough moisture to permit germination, some farmers in Cordoba and coastal Buenos Aires needed rain in the next few days. If they did not receive it, they would be forced to wait to plant sunflower or soybeans. Sunflower sowing reached 5.1 percent of three million hectares.

Intended total planting (thousands of hectares) and the percentage already sown (year-earlier in brackets). Harvest levels (thousands of hectares) and as a percentage of planted area, (year-earlier in brackets). Yield in quintals per hectare.
